meanings.definition: To look or glance sideways or askance.
meanings.sent1: She cockeyes at the strange noise coming from the bushes.
meanings.sent2: He always cockeyes when he's trying to read the small print.
meanings.sent3: The cat cockeyes suspiciously at the new dog in the house.
meanings.sent4: The detective cockeyes at the suspect, trying to catch any signs of guilt.
meanings.sent5: The child cockeyes at the colorful balloons floating in the sky.

meanings.sent1: She gave him a quick cockeyes before turning away.
meanings.sent2: His cockeyes revealed his uncertainty about the situation.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's exaggerated cockeyes made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her cockeyes were like a secret code, conveying her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The old man's cockeyes held a lifetime of stories and wisdom.

meanings.definition: To have a squinting or oblique look.
meanings.sent1: The teacher cockeyes at the misbehaving student in the back of the class.
meanings.sent2: She cockeyes whenever she's trying to focus on something far away.
meanings.sent3: The owl cockeyes at the tiny mouse scurrying across the field.
meanings.sent4: The artist cockeyes at the blank canvas, envisioning the masterpiece to come.
meanings.sent5: The photographer cockeyes through the lens, capturing the perfect shot.
